name: MediaTrackConstraints
description: The MediaTrackConstraints dictionary is used to describe a set of capabilities and the value or values each can take on. A constraints dictionary is passed into applyConstraints() to allow a script to establish a set of exact (required) values or ranges and/or preferred values or ranges of values for the track, and the most recently-requested set of custom constraints can be retrieved by calling getConstraints().

members.name: deviceId
members.description: A ConstrainDOMString object specifying a device ID or an array of device IDs which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: groupId
members.description: A ConstrainDOMString object specifying a group ID or an array of group IDs which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: autoGainControl
members.description: A ConstrainBoolean object which specifies whether automatic gain control is preferred and/or required.

members.name: channelCount
members.description: A ConstrainLong specifying the channel count or range of channel counts which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: echoCancellation
members.description: A ConstrainBoolean object specifying whether or not echo cancellation is preferred and/or required.

members.name: latency
members.description: A ConstrainDouble specifying the latency or range of latencies which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: noiseSuppression
members.description: A ConstrainBoolean object which specifies whether noise suppression is preferred and/or required.

members.name: sampleRate
members.description: A ConstrainLong specifying the sample rate or range of sample rates which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: sampleSize
members.description: A ConstrainLong specifying the sample size or range of sample sizes which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: volume
members.description: A ConstrainDouble specifying the volume or range of volumes which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: aspectRatio
members.description: A ConstrainDouble specifying the video aspect ratio or range of aspect ratios which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: facingMode
members.description: A ConstrainDOMString object specifying a facing or an array of facings which are acceptable and/or required.

parameters.name: "user"
parameters.description: The video source is facing toward the user; this includes, for example, the front-facing camera on a smartphone.

parameters.name: "environment"
parameters.description: The video source is facing away from the user, thereby viewing their environment. This is the back camera on a smartphone.

parameters.name: "left"
parameters.description: The video source is facing toward the user but to their left, such as a camera aimed toward the user but over their left shoulder.

parameters.name: "right"
parameters.description: The video source is facing toward the user but to their right, such as a camera aimed toward the user but over their right shoulder.

members.name: frameRate
members.description: A ConstrainDouble specifying the frame rate or range of frame rates which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: height
members.description: A ConstrainLong specifying the video height or range of heights which are acceptable and/or required.

members.name: width
members.description: A ConstrainLong specifying the video width or range of widths which are acceptable and/or required.
